definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to scatter like birds and beasts
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions

sentences.english: The party fizzled out before midnight.
sentences.chinese: 參加聚會的人在午夜前作鳥獸散。

sentences.english: Birds resort unto their like: so truth will return to them that practise her.
sentences.chinese: 鳥獸與同類相聚，真理也必歸於實行真理的人。

sentences.english: They are against all blood sports, especially foxhunting.
sentences.chinese: 他們反對以獵殺鳥獸爲樂，尤其是獵狐。

sentences.english: He is so kind even to birds and beasts. He must be more merciful to human beings.
sentences.chinese: 他對鳥獸都如此仁慈，何況是對人呢？

sentences.english: With their commander gone, the remainder of the Burning Legion's army was cast into disarray.
sentences.chinese: 指揮官陣亡，燃燒軍團的餘黨作鳥獸散。

sentences.english: At the first sign of trouble, the supporters melted away.
sentences.chinese: 那些支持者一看要有麻煩便作鳥獸散。

sentences.english: So cold was it that even the animals and the birds did not know what to make of it.
sentences.chinese: 實在是太冷了，連鳥獸們都不知該如何度過這寒夜了。

sentences.english: The fire had depleted the game in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 那場大火使森林裏的鳥獸瀕臨絕跡。

sentences.english: Alice led the way, and the whole party swam to the shore.
sentences.chinese: 愛麗絲領着路，和這羣鳥獸一起自岸邊游去。

sentences.english: The regeneration of korean pinus must relies on birds and mammals.
sentences.chinese: 紅松因爲自身的特點要依賴鳥獸完成天然更新。

sentences.english: But the indigenous peoples did not run away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，土著人並沒有如鳥獸散。

sentences.english: When the People's Liberation Army crossed the Yangtse River, the U. S. colonial government at Nanking fled helter-skelter.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放軍橫渡長江，南京的美國殖民政府如鳥獸散。

sentences.english: All night long I can hear the strange sounds of wild birds and animals .
sentences.chinese: 我整夜都聽見野生鳥獸發出的奇怪的聲音。

sentences.english: Hongshan culture jade groups have emerged, most with birds and beasts as the main body.
sentences.chinese: 紅山文化湧現出的玉器羣，多數以鳥獸形爲主體。

definition: that being the case/then/in that case
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
"Erya" or "The Ready Guide", first extant Chinese dictionary, c. 3rd century BC, with glossaries on classical texts
